case_vignette: A 27-year-old woman visits a psychiatrist expressing her feelings of sadness which are present on most days of the week. She says that she has been feeling this way for about 2 to 3 years. During her first pregnancy 3 years ago, the fetus died in utero, and the pregnancy was terminated at 21 weeks. Ever since then, she hasn’t been able to sleep well at night and has difficulty concentrating on her tasks most of the time. However, for the past month, she has found it more difficult to cope. She says she has no will to have another child as she still feels guilty and responsible for the previous pregnancy. Over the past few days, she has completely lost her appetite and only eats once or twice a day. She doesn’t recall a single day in the last 3 years where she has not felt this way. The patient denies any past or current smoking, alcohol, or recreational drug use.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

I've been feeling very sad most days, I'm sleeping poorly, having trouble focusing, and recently I've completely lost my appetite, eating only once or twice a day.
Have you had any changes in your weight or energy levels recently?
I haven't mentioned any specific changes in my weight or energy levels.
Have you had any recent stressful events or changes in your life?
For the past month, I've found it more difficult to cope with my feelings.
Have you had any history of depression or anxiety?
I haven't mentioned any past history of depression or anxiety.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or sleep quality?
Ever since my loss 3 years ago, I haven't been able to sleep well at night.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or eating habits?
Yes, over the past few days, I've completely lost my appetite and only eat once or twice a day.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or energy levels?
I haven't mentioned any specific changes in my weight or energy levels recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress levels or workload?
For the past month, it's been more difficult for me to cope, so I guess that means my stress levels have changed recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
I haven't mentioned taking any medication or supplements.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history or medical history?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my family or medical history.
Final Diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder.
